subject: Re: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: There s an article on www.mockobjects.com that describes this. If you download the library, the CVS repository is more up to date than the tar file. Steve ...
messageBody:
There's an article on www.mockobjects.com that describes this.

If you download the library, the CVS repository is more up to date than the tar file.

Steve

----- Original Message -----
From: "Bernd Proissl" <lists@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, November 16, 2001 7:39 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?


> > How do you write tests that cause a database connection to fail after you
> > sent the query, but before you got the result back so that the result set
> > throws an exception?
>
> search the web for "mock objects"
>
> Bernd
